name: Big Beefy HB
description:
This is my HB deck I've been having a lot of fun with. It's won about 85% of the matches it has been put through. There's no neat combos or anything like that, just solid, powerful ICE and assets that all have some sort of impact. The only real "trick" this deck plays is common with Next Design. Bait the runner with Accelerated Beta Test and have them find they wasted their turn and a bunch of economy for an asset.

One card I'm expecting people to comment on is Mandatory Upgrades. The card is bonkers if you can score it, even late game and if it's stolen it's only 2 points and saves you 6 advancement.

Please give any and all feedback/ideas, and I'll try to answer and acknowledge all questions and comments. Thanks.

name: Februnner Jinteki
description:
Deck usato in occasione del torneo Februnner a Roma il 23/02/14

Risultato: 5to posto

name: Februnner Criminal
description:
Deck usato in occasione del torneo Februnner a Roma il 23/02/14

Risultato: 5to posto

name: Nice or Naughty 1.0
description:
Still a prototype, but it's been working so far.

Activist Support + NACH + Aesop's to stop the tags from coming.

Then, Blackmail away when you see them advance! :p

Lather, rinse and repeat.

name: Vampy kit 1.0
description:
My take on the vamping kit. Using GB and snowball because of those infamous power shutdowns. I haven't played this yet but I will report how it goes after some testing.

Comments and suggestion are welcome.

name: Rielle V.8
Weyland Greeeeu!!
Weyland-Tournament
Reina - Tournament
Rush n Trash
description: First attempt at a TWIY deck - push agendas and kill icebreakers. Could be light on economy.

name: My First "Kit" w/Omega
description: I will try to play this tonight, see what happens. Leave comments please.

name: Nice or Naughty 1.1
description:
A quick update on the Blackmail deck I published earlier.

Added Masanori to keep the whole thing cycling later, Chakana to slow down fast advance, Kati because you'll really run low and you'd rather go big than gain 1 credit, Desperado to refund your Blackmails.

Find your Activist Support, Aesop's, and NACH as fast as you can. When you do, get them down and make sure you have 2 credits to avoid the tag.

From there onward, it's smooth sailing. If they remove the BP, use Deja Vu to recur Activist Support.

Against FA, it's harder because Chakana needs 3 runs on R&D, but you really can't find a better alternative than that.

Feel free to trash SMCs to Aesop's if you're not yet set up.

name: Jinteki's Refinery
description: based on another deck I saw on here but wth my person changes

name: Killer Queen
description: Based on "Blackguard of the Red Queen" by Heartthrob (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2576/blackguard-of-the-red-queen) but going full on ICE destruction. Made the corp rezz an ICE with Snitch + Blackguard? Parasite it. They cant rez it? Forged it. Raymond Flint instead of Infiltration because exposing midrun is amazing. Darwin to any ICE alive that may hurt you.

name: Chaos theory BigRig
description: Test run + Scavenge for breakers. Dinosaurus primarily for Morning Star. Chakana is there to slow down the Corp while the rig is setting up.

name: Black Andromeda
description: Violent assault economic with Account Siphon and expose/Blackguard. I choose Andromeda to have Blackguard + Snitch very quickly early game.

name: Jinteki never advance
description: This is a deck based primarily around hitting the runner with some brain damage while making it extremely painful to run anywhere. Ive been playing around with it and find it extremely fun to watch the runner squirm over whether or not to run. Subliminal messaging is a great kick in the pants to make careful runners make bad choices.

name: Professional Thief v3.0
Professional Thief v3.1
Professional Thief v3.2
Neural Strike v3.0
Always Advance v0.3
description: Defend your central servers, then start creating remotes and always advance when possible. Lure the runner to traps or just score agendas. Still need some work

name: Snarin'HB!
description: This is first deck I save. It likes me and I will use it, maybe, in a tourney near Milan(i'm from Italy).

name: Reina Roja + Parasite
description:
Idea of a deck to get economy control and try to get rid of the ice fast.

Deja vu+clone clips to reuse the parasites.

Parasites+Ice Carver+datasucker to kill those ices.

Bishop could be a Keyhole, im testing it.

Rook + Reina roja+Xanadu to pass thru the ice unrezzed.

Corroder+Mimic+Yog as icebreakers, and crypsis as jack of all traits, plus Femme to get rid of those really big and nasty ice.

name: 1.3.2.5.1 RP Refinery
description: Dew Refinery was my direct inspiration for this list. I made this list from scratch after looking at it and was amused to see how similar they turned out. One of my main goals was find a better ice spread, though 2 strength is still rather prevalent. I really want to use a rezzed Refinery to draw a run away from an installed agenda. I used the same tactic to force a run in a SEA Source deck, advance a rezzed Refinery until the runner either runs it or you make bank. Takes an unwary runner, but it is great when it works.

name: Knightgame Theory
description:
A take on an agressive chaos theory, she is chosen because she enables the deck to function without any additional MU besides the dinosaur.

This deck is very agressive, and wants to start running asap: Use test run & scavenge to get femme on the board and lock up his R&D, but don't be shy about using test run without a scavenge, since you will draw a lot of cards with professional contracts, and can always put the femme back in the yard for another test. Knights are the definite allstar for the early game, and i have used test run without scavenge a lot of times, just to tutor for it.

Sharpshooter & deus ex for escaping the nasty surprise walls, and mimic because femme is just too damn expensive to get mid-run.

Corroder & gordian blade is for the mid/lategame and really isn't needed for the first 5-7 turns of the game.

Chakana is specifically included for HB Fast advance, sinces it makes it impossible to score a 3/x agenda from the hand with biotic labor, getting it charged isn't a problem since you want to be running R&D most of the time anyways.

As mulliganning goes, you want 1-2 economy cards and a test run or SMC in your starting hand (Stimhack counts as an economy card with SMC!)

By all means go ahead a post suggestions for improvements, i'm not sure about the economy of the deck :)

name: Knightgame Theory v1.1
description:
Changes from v1.0:

-1 Account siphon +2 Liberated account

A take on an agressive chaos theory, she is chosen because she enables the deck to function without any additional MU besides the dinosaur.

This deck is very agressive, and wants to start running asap: Use test run & scavenge to get femme on the board and lock up his R&D, but don't be shy about using test run without a scavenge, since you will draw a lot of cards with professional contracts, and can always put the femme back in the yard for another test. Knights are the definite allstar for the early game, and i have used test run without scavenge a lot of times, just to tutor for it.

Sharpshooter & deus ex for escaping the nasty surprise walls, and mimic because femme is just too damn expensive to get mid-run.

Corroder & gordian blade is for the mid/lategame and really isn't needed for the first 5-7 turns of the game.

Chakana is specifically included for HB Fast advance, sinces it makes it impossible to score a 3/x agenda from the hand with biotic labor, getting it charged isn't a problem since you want to be running R&D most of the time anyways.

As mulliganning goes, you want 1-2 economy cards and a test run or SMC in your starting hand (Stimhack counts as an economy card with SMC!)

By all means go ahead a post suggestions for improvements, i'm not sure about the economy of the deck :)

name: Personal Business 2.0
description: No combo, but it can still flatline. Tyrant, Ice Wall and Draco are there to make runs expensive and varied. Based on a friends deck.

name: Scavenge Chaos Theory
GRNDL Tag and Bag
Aggressive Gabe
Blue Virus
description: Three djinn to get your virus' out quick. Drop crypsis asap then datasucker . Build credits. Go. Tutor virus as you need them. Need money ?Gorman drip. Rd wide open? Medium. Hq wide open? Nerve agent. Giant dick ice? Parasite. Corp holding cards for nasty combos/scorched? Imp or drop hemorrhage early. Crypsis is very click intensive and pricey but once hes out you dont need much. Click for a counter .click katie or liberated and run. Very consistent so far . Any feedback is appreciated

name: Weyland - Scorched Programs
description:
Half your ICE are ETR, Force them to get out their breakers ASAP, then burn them away with Power Shutdowns, Aggressive Secs and your Destroyer ICE.

Subliminal Messaging can help you to fire off your Destroyers too by encouraging them to run more. If they don't, well that means more money for your Corporate Troubleshooters then.

Snipe Self Modifying Codes with your Power Shutdowns when you can to prevent the runner from making full use of your bad pub.

Have fun. See how much bad pub you can stack!
